content: in next 4 single_crochet 2c in each of next 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next 6 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in each of next 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet 20 single_crochet leave 18 tail to sew muzzle to head fasten_off tail with mc chain 14 making sure 1st 3 chs are fairly loose round 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and next 9 chs 3 single_crochet in each of next 3 chain 19 single_crochet turn round 2 slip_stitch in each single_crochet fig 4 leave 12 tail to sew tail to body fasten_off © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 3 - dilly the kitten finishing 1 stuff body do not sew shut you may wish to put some plastic pellets in the bottom of the body before stuffing to add some weight and stability if you do i recommend placing the pellets inside a small fabric pouch before putting them in the body otherwise they are likely to eventually fall out between the spaces of the single crochets this is not only messy but also a potential choking hazard for small children i cut two circles approx 3 in diameter from scrap fabric sew them together leaving a 1 opening fill the pouch with a scant ¼ cup of pellets and then stitch the opening shut 2 sew head to body using inside loops only of last round of body 3 stuff arms lightly and sew to body 4 sew tail to body fig 5 5 weave ends in ears and then sew ears to head i usually sew them between round 8 & 9 6 stuff muzzle lightly and sew to face using inside loops only of last round of muzzle 7 sew felt eyes to face alternatively embroider eyes to face 8 embroider eyebrows mouth and whiskers fig 6 © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 4 - dilly the kitten fig 1 fig 2 fig 3 piece a fig 4 fig 5 fig 6 © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 5 -
